page.title: 06FORESTRY
page.content: The north_western corner of the D_ block,{Yateley Heath Wood,}is occupied by the Forestry Commission. The Commission has leased the land from the Calthorpe estate since 1923. The forests are mostly conifers, but there has been more emphasis on non_ coniferous "amenity" planting since 1970. There are no public rights of way through the Commission's woods. The forest centre at 809586 also administers neighbouring woods at Railroad Heath, Warren Heath, Bramshill, and Crowthorne. It under_ _takes general vehicle maintenance for other forest centres in south_ eastern England. Another responsibility is local motorway planting. Some 23 full_time forestry staff are employed.
